intro: Eschscholzia dumetorum, commonly known as the dwarf California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies, and is characterized by its vibrant orange or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Eschscholzia dumetorum is also known for its delicate, short stature, usually reaching only a few inches in height.
